Steve_Grand:
{{short description|American singer-songwriter}} {{About|the singer-songwriter|the roboticist|Steve Grand (roboticist)}} {{Use mdy dates|date=October 2016}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Steve Grand | image = Steve Grand - 1032013.png | caption = Steve Grand at the Come Out With Pride in October 2013. | alias = Steve Chatham
Steve Starchild | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1990|2|28|mf=yes}} | birth_place = [[Lemont, Illinois]] | genre = [[Pop rock music|Pop rock]], [[Country music|country]], [[crossover (music)|crossover]] | occupation = Model, musician, singer, songwriter | instrument = Vocals, piano, guitar | years_active = 2011–present | label = Grand Nation | website = {{URL|www.stevegrand.com}} }} '''Steve Grand''' (born February 28, 1990){{cite web |url=http://stevegrand.net/our-interview-with-steve-grand/ |title=SteveGrand.net - Our Interview with Steve Grand |access-date=2014-10-12 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20141016012642/http://stevegrand.net/our-interview-with-steve-grand/ |archive-date=October 16, 2014 |df=mdy-all }} is an American singer, songwriter and model from [[Lemont, Illinois]], a Chicago suburb.{{cite web |url=http://www.thebacklot.com/interview-all-american-boy-steve-grand-gay-country-western-star/07/2013/ |title=TheBacklot Interview: "All-American Boy" Steve Grand |access-date=2013-07-18 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130712045816/http://www.thebacklot.com/interview-all-american-boy-steve-grand-gay-country-western-star/07/2013 |archive-date=July 12, 2013| publisher=[[TheBacklot.com]] | date=July 8, 2013 | author=Virtel, Louis |df=mdy-all}} He became an overnight [[internet celebrity]] and the music video of his first hit "[[All-American Boy]]" went [[viral video|viral]] on [[YouTube]] in less than a week in July 2013.{{cite web |url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/07/08/steve-grand-all-american-boy-_n_3560867.html | title=Steve Grand's 'All-American Boy' Becomes A Gay-Themed Country Music Hit on YouTube | work=The Huffington Post | date=July 8, 2013 | access-date=July 8, 2013 | author=Lennox, Michael Cidoni}}{{cite news |url=http://www.salon.com/2013/07/08/steve_grand_hailed_as_first_openly_gay_male_country_singer_with_youtube_hit/singleton/ | title=Steve Grand hailed as first openly gay male country singer with YouTube hit | date=July 8, 2013 | work=Salon | access-date=July 8, 2013 | author=Gupta, Prachi}}{{cite magazine | url=http://entertainment.time.com/2013/07/08/gay-themed-music-video-a-youtube-hit/ | title=Gay-Themed Music Video a YouTube Hit | magazine=[[Time (magazine)|Time]] | date=July 8, 2013 | access-date=July 8, 2013 | url-status=dead | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130712003025/http://entertainment.time.com/2013/07/08/gay-themed-music-video-a-youtube-hit/ | archive-date=July 12, 2013 | df=mdy-all }} This attention landed Grand on ''[[Good Morning America]]'', [[CNN]] and other national media.{{cite news|title=ABC's Good Morning America: Gay Country Singer Adjusts to Newfound Web Fame|url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/video/steve-grand-american-boy-music-video-viral-gay-19615144|date=July 9, 2013}}{{cite news|title=CNN Newsroom: A New Kind of Country|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PlIEJIuTHm0|date=July 20, 2013}}{{Citation|last=Larry King|title=My World Would Have Changed {{!}} Steve Grand {{!}} Larry King Now - Ora TV|date=2014-02-27|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=ri8YISIDsAk|access-date=2016-10-31}} In addition to being a musician, Grand has become an active figure in the LGBT equality movement.{{cite news|last=Nichols|first=James|title=Steve Grand, Gay 'All-American Boy' Singer, Performs at New York's Bailey House Benefit|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2013/10/11/steve-grand-bailey-house-_n_4086351.html|newspaper=The Huffington Post|date=October 11, 2013}}{{cite news|title=The VitalVOICE: Steve Grand to Perform at March on Springfield|url=http://www.thevitalvoice.com/news/50-latest-news/1027-steve-grand-to-perform-at-march-on-springfield}}{{cite news|title=Openly Gay Record Artist, Songwriter & YouTube Sensation Steve Grand to Perform His Hit Single "All American Boy" at GLSEN Respect Awards - Los Angeles|url=http://glsen.org/article/steve-grand-perform-respect-awards|date=October 4, 2013}} He released his debut album titled ''[[All American Boy (Steve Grand album)|All American Boy]]'' financed by a successful ''[[Kickstarter]]'' public funding campaign. The follow-up album ''Not the End of Me'' was released in 2018. ==Life and career== === 1990–2010: Early life === Grand grew up in the town of [[Lemont, Illinois]], which he has "lovingly described as one of the 'blandest suburbs outside of Chicago'."{{cite news|url=http://metrosource.com.s123317.gridserver.com/2015/05/14/grand-ideas/|title=Grand Ideas: A unique voice at a special moment, singer-songwriter Steve Grand introduces himself - on his term s|last=Gurry|first=Matt|work=Metrosource|issue=June–July 2015|pages=34–37|access-date=May 21, 2015}} Grand started writing music when he was 11 years old. After graduating from [[Lemont High School]], Grand attended [[Belmont University]] in [[Nashville, Tennessee]], for a year. He then returned to Chicago to enroll at the [[University of Illinois at Chicago|University of Illinois]] and later left to focus on his musical career.{{cite web|url=http://www.thecenterorlando.org/2013/07/05/our-first-country-gay-music-video-steve-grand-all-american-boy/|title=Our First Country Gay Music Video: Steve Grand – All American Boy|date=July 5, 2013|publisher=The Center Orlando|access-date=July 8, 2013|url-status=dead|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130710010141/http://www.thecenterorlando.org/2013/07/05/our-first-country-gay-music-video-steve-grand-all-american-boy/|archive-date=July 10, 2013|df=mdy-all}} Grand cites a wide range of musical influences, including: [[The Beatles]], [[The Rolling Stones]], [[Led Zeppelin]], [[Neil Young]], [[Bruce Springsteen]], [[Elton John]], [[Billy Joel]], [[Blink-182]], [[Green Day]], [[Taking Back Sunday]], [[Brand New (band)|Brand New]], [[Lady Gaga]] and [[Fall Out Boy]]. Grand told ''QVegas'': "But it was Dad who got me started. He would listen to a song and tell stories about what each song meant to him: where he was in life, who he was dating, what car he was driving. He made me realize the lasting power of music -- how a great song can take you back to the moment you first heard it. From that point on, I knew that's what I wanted to do in life, create something so real and beautiful that it stays with its listener forever."{{cite news|title=Steve Grand ALL AMERICAN BOY|url=http://qvegas.com/november-2013-the-holiday-issue/features/cover-story-steve-grand|date=November 2013|access-date=February 20, 2014|archive-date=February 20, 2014|archive-url=https://archive.today/20140220170654/http://qvegas.com/november-2013-the-holiday-issue/features/cover-story-steve-grand|url-status=dead}} === 2011–2015: Career beginnings and ''All American Boy'' === Prior to launching his musical career, Grand [[model (profession)|modeled]] under a number of pseudonyms; he was a cover model for Australia's ''[[DNA (magazine)|DNA]]'' magazine in 2011 with a photo session shot by photographer Tom Cullis.{{cite web | url=http://www.dnamagazine.com.au/articles/news.asp?news_id=19614 | title=Steve Grand Was Our No. 127 Cover Model | publisher=DNA Magazine | date=July 5, 2013 | access-date=July 24, 2013 | url-status=dead | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130720035527/http://www.dnamagazine.com.au/articles/news.asp?news_id=19614 | archive-date=July 20, 2013 | df=mdy-all }} He played piano at four Chicago-area churches and at various clubs in Chicago, most notably The Joynt in downtown Chicago, until 2013. He also performed cover songs, including hits by Lady Gaga, [[Bruno Mars]], [[One Direction]] and [[Journey (band)|Journey]], and uploaded these to YouTube under the name '''Steve [Starchild]'''. However, Grand wanted to release original music. On July 2, 2013, Grand uploaded a music video for his song "[[All-American Boy (song)|All-American Boy]]" to YouTube—producing it himself at a cost of [[United States dollar|US$]]7,000. The video almost immediately went viral. Just eight days later, "All-American Boy" had more than 1 million views.{{cite web | url=http://gopride.com/Z8l8 | title=Chicago's gay country 'All-American Boy' Steve Grand hits 1m views | publisher=Chicago Pride | date=July 11, 2013 | access-date=July 11, 2013 | author=Inawat, Ron Matthew | archive-date=July 12, 2013 | archive-url=https://archive.today/20130712043703/http://gopride.com/Z8l8 | url-status=dead }}{{cite web | url=http://www.fuse.tv/2013/07/steve-grand-all-american-boy-gay-country-singer-viral | title=Meet Gay Country Star Steve Grand | publisher=Fuse | date=July 9, 2013 | access-date=July 9, 2013 | author=Benjamin, Jeff}}{{cite web | url=https://abcnews.go.com/GMA/video/steve-grand-american-boy-music-video-viral-gay-19615144 | title=Gay Country Singer Adjusts to Newfound Web Fame | publisher=[[ABC News (United States)|ABC News]] [[Good Morning America]] | date=July 9, 2013 | access-date=July 9, 2013 | author=Connelly, Chris}}{{cite news | url=http://www.indystar.com/interactive/article/20130708/NEWS09/307080057/Steve-Grand-called-first-openly-gay-country-singer-after-video-release | title=Steve Grand called first openly gay country singer after video release | newspaper=[[Indianapolis Star]] | date=July 8, 2013 | access-date=July 9, 2013 | author=Shamberger, Ebony}} The song, set against a backdrop of country roads, an American flag and friends around a campfire, tells the story of a young man in love with a heterosexual male friend. Grand recorded the vocals in his parents' basement and maxed out his credit card to self-fund the video. The video was directed and edited by filmmaker Jason Knade.{{cite web|last1=Inawat|first1=Matt|title=Jason Knade Interview|url=http://chicago.gopride.com/news/interview.cfm/articleid/519025|publisher=ChicagoPride.com|access-date=September 17, 2016|archive-date=September 17, 2016|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20160917162042/http://chicago.gopride.com/news/interview.cfm/articleid/519025|url-status=dead}} [[BuzzFeed]] ranked the video for "All-American Boy" on its list of the "24 Most Brilliant Music Videos from 2013", and ''[[Out (magazine)|Out]]'' magazine named Grand to its annual "Out100" list of the year's most compelling [[LGBT]] people.{{cite web|last=Perpetua|first=Matthew|title=Buzzfeed: 24 Of The Most Brilliant Music Videos From 2013|website=[[BuzzFeed]] |date=December 11, 2013 |url=https://www.buzzfeed.com/perpetua/best-music-videos-2013|access-date=December 11, 2013}}{{cite news|title=Out100: Steve Grand|url=http://www.out.com/out-exclusives/out100-2013/2013/11/05/out100-steve-grand|newspaper=Out Magazine|date=November 5, 2013}} On July 18, 2013, Grand made his television debut, performing "All-American Boy" on [[WLS-TV]] produced program ''[[Windy City Live]]''.{{cite web | url=http://www.towleroad.com/2013/07/steve-grands-slow-rendition-of-all-american-boy-will-melt-your-heart-video.html | title=Steve Grand's Slow Rendition of "All-American Boy" Will Melt Your Heart | publisher=[[Towleroad.com]] | date=July 18, 2013 | access-date=July 22, 2013 | author=Geoffroy, Kyler }} Some media have claimed that Grand is the "first openly gay male country singer", although this has been disputed.{{cite web|url=http://www.theatlanticwire.com/entertainment/2013/07/steve-grand-first-gay-country-star-neither-first-gay-country-singer-nor-star/67029/|title=We Should Stop Calling Steve Grand the First Openly Gay Male Country Star|author=Schonfeld, Zach|date=July 10, 2013|work=[[The Atlantic]]|access-date=July 11, 2013|archive-date=October 4, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20131004213100/http://www.theatlanticwire.com/entertainment/2013/07/steve-grand-first-gay-country-star-neither-first-gay-country-singer-nor-star/67029/|url-status=dead}} Grand does not claim to be the first of his kind, and often talks with praise about the trailblazers who have come before him. Several gay male country musicians have toured gay bars and other venues for decades, beginning with Patrick Haggerty's band [[Lavender Country]] in 1972,{{cite journal|last=Dickinson|first=Chris|year=2000|title=Country Undetectable: Gay Artists in Country Music|url=http://www.queermusicheritage.us/mar2005jcm.html|journal=Journal of Country Music|volume=XXI|issue=1|pages=28–39|access-date=August 4, 2009}} and two months before Grand's video hit, ''[[The New York Times]]'' profiled openly gay singer/songwriter [[Shane McAnally]],[https://www.nytimes.com/2013/05/26/arts/music/out-and-riding-high-in-nashville.html "Out and Riding High in Nashville"]. ''[[The New York Times]]'', May 24, 2013. who has had charted songs as a vocalist in the past and is currently one of the most successful songwriters in the industry. Other openly gay or bisexual male vocalists who have had successful careers in the country music industry as songwriters or musicians have included [[Jimbeau Hinson]], [[Drake Jensen]], [[Mark Weigle]], Brian Glenn,{{cite web|url=http://www.outandaboutnashville.com/story/brian-glenn-steps-out-his-own-original |title=Brian Glenn steps out on his own with 'Original Intent' | Out & About Nashville |publisher=Outandaboutnashville.com |access-date=August 12, 2013}} and Shane Stevens.{{cite web|last=Halterman |first=Jim |url=http://www.thebacklot.com/shane-stevens-on-girls-who-like-boys-who-like-jesus/11/2011/ |title=Shane Stevens on 'Girls Who Like Boys'... Who Like Jesus |publisher=thebacklot.com |date=November 18, 2011 |access-date=August 12, 2013}} Openly gay country star [[Chely Wright]] lauded Grand as "brave" in remarks to Michael Musto of Out.com, saying: "This is uncharted territory, as you know. I came out after having been in the business for years. He's trying to get {{em|into}} the business." On a number of interviews and media appearances, Grand disputes himself being a country artist. In an interview with ''[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]]'', New York in preparation for the launching of his debut album ''All-American Boy'', he says: "There's a lot of talk about me being a country artist, and that was the headline from the start: ''Gay country artist''. I never really identified with that — I certainly didn't put that out there myself, and I've never done anything to affirm that label. That was something that was just placed on me. I mean, I understand, [the song] "All-American Boy" does sound country, and the video is certainly very country. But there's stuff that's very dance-pop with not a trace of country on the record. So I think that will surprise people. But I'm a songwriter, and I've always been much more concerned about just the basic elements, the lyric and the melody rather than the production."{{cite web | url=http://www.timeout.com/newyork/gay-lesbian/steve-grand-gets-set-to-launch-his-debut-album-all-american-boy | title=Steve Grand gets set to launch his debut album, All-American Boy - The singer arrives in New York for a Valentine's Day show, and he's ready to leave the whole "gay country artist" thing behind | publisher=[[Time Out (magazine)|Time Out]] New York| date=February 11, 2015 | access-date=February 12, 2015 | author=Ethan LaCroix }} ''Metrosource'' wrote that ''All-American Boy'' has "disparate" song styles, but it "works as a cohesive unit - rarely seen today...." On September 6, 2013, Grand released "Stay", the follow-up single to "All-American Boy".[http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/all-american-boy-singer-steve-grand-has-new-song-and-video-far-happier-ending060913 "All-American Boy singer Steve Grand has new song and video with far happier ending"] September 6, 2013 followed by "Time" in 2014.{{cite news|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.com/2014/11/04/steve-grand-new-music_n_6101684.html|author= Curtis M. Wong|title=Steve Grand Releases New Single, 'Time,' and Cover of Elton John's 'Bennie and the Jets'|work=[[The Huffington Post]]|date=November 4, 2014|access-date=February 12, 2015}} He announced plans to release his debut album financed by a successful ''[[Kickstarter]]'' public funding campaign. Just one day after the launch, the original $81,000 goal had been reached and in within 5 days, double the original funding goal, and by close, $326,593 had been pledged by 4,905 backers.[https://www.kickstarter.com/projects/stevegrand/all-american-boy-the-album Kickstarter: "All-American Boy" - The Album by Steve Grand] The album titled ''All-American Boy'' was released on March 24, 2015.[http://www.out.com/entertainment/popnography/2015/01/28/steve-grand%E2%80%99s-debut-album-all-american-boy-out-march-24th out.com: Steve Grand's Debut Album All-American Boy Out March 24th] Since releasing his first album, Grand has travelled across the United States performing at Gay Pride Festivals and supporting gay causes. On June 20, 2014, Grand performed at the WorldPride Toronto 2014 opening ceremonies. Steve Grand performed during the ceremony along with Melissa Etheridge, Deborah Cox, and Tom Robinson. Toronto, with a population of approximately 6.4 million people, held 3 marches over 3 days: Trans march, Dyke march, and the WorldPride Parade. In June 2015, Grand made his first trip to Europe as an Arts Envoy of the Bureau of Educational and Cultural Affairs for the U.S. State Department. He and his band promoted LGBT rights in Austria. While in Austria, he gave a talk and did a video for the local NGO "It Gets Better."{{Citation|last=eswirdbesserAT|title=IT GETS BETTER with Steve Grand! {{!}} #eswirdbesser {{!}} #ProudToBe {{!}} #itgetsbetter|date=2015-06-10|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BGQawqPQkLo|access-date=2016-10-31}} He gave a concert hosted by the Tri-Mission Ambassadors at the residence of Ambassador Alexa Wesner, a concert for Vienna's LGBT community as well as a concert at the Pride festival in Graz.{{Cite news|url=https://at.usembassy.gov/steve-grand/|title=Steve Grand {{!}} U.S. Embassy in Austria|date=2015-06-10|newspaper=U.S. Embassy in Austria|language=en-US|access-date=2016-10-31}} He also performed at Europride in Riga, Latvia.{{Cite news|url=http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/steve-grand-and-stuart-milk-attend-europride-riga-latvia-%E2%80%93-full-report-pictures220615/#gs.JSQiwkY|title=Steve Grand and Stuart Milk attend EuroPride in Riga, Latvia – full report with pictures|date=2015-06-22|newspaper=Gay Star News|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-10-31}} In December 2015, Grand produced a bluesy and soulful reprise of Mariah Carey's "All I Want for Christmas Is You".{{Citation|last=Steve Grand|title=Steve Grand - "All I Want For Christmas Is You" (Official Music Video)|date=2015-12-21|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Qlpnt-6HQZo|access-date=2016-10-31}} === 2016–2018: ''Not the End of Me'' and acting === In March 2016, Grand and singer/songwriter [[Eli Lieb]] co-wrote a duet "Look Away".{{Citation|last=Eli Lieb|title=Eli Lieb, Steve Grand - Look Away|date=2016-03-29|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=9eJDYilZezU|access-date=2016-10-31}} By November 2016 the music video had received over 1,000,000 views on YouTube. In March 2017, Grand performed at the Gay Mardi Gras in Sydney, Australia {{Cite news|url=http://www.gaytimes.co.uk/guys/64651/steve-grand-sydney-mardi-gras-2017/|title=Gay Times}} and Gay Pride Tampa, Florida.{{Cite news|url=http://www.cltampa.com/music/music-news/article/20855119/steve-grand-set-to-headline-tampa-pride-on-march-25-listen|title=cltampa.com}} Grand made his acting debut in December 2017 on the web series "Falling for Angels" (a Here TV/Pride Media project).{{Cite web|url=http://www.windycitymediagroup.com/lgbt/WEB-Steve-Grand-makes-acting-debut-in-Falling-for-Angels-/61406.html|title=WEB Steve Grand makes acting debut in 'Falling for Angels' - Gay Lesbian Bi Trans News Archive - Windy City Times|website=Windy City Times|date=December 19, 2017|access-date=2018-07-10}} During the summers of 2017 and 2018, Grand took up residence in [[Provincetown, Massachusetts]], while performing weekly at the Art House.{{Cite news|url=http://www.digitaljournal.com/entertainment/music/steve-grand-talks-new-album-not-the-end-of-me-the-art-house/article/526235|title=Steve Grand talks new album 'Not the End of Me,' The Art House (Includes interview)|date=2018-07-03|access-date=2018-07-06}} Grand's second album, "Not the End of Me," was released on July 6, 2018.{{Cite news|url=https://www.queerty.com/steve-grand-getting-sober-social-anxiety-new-album-not-end-20180704|title=Steve Grand on getting sober, battling social anxiety and his new album 'Not the End of Me'|last=Russell|first=John|date=2018-07-04|access-date=2018-07-10}} The music on this album reflects Grand's development as an artist and performer with a wide array of songs capturing his moods and personal experience.{{Cite news|url=https://celebmix.com/track-by-track-album-review-steve-grand-not-the-end-of-me/|title=Track-By-Track Album Review: Steve Grand – Not The End Of Me|author=Currinn, Jonathan|date=2018-07-13|work=CelebMix|access-date=2018-07-14|language=en-GB}} Not The End Of Me appeared at number 10 on the Billboard independent charts for the week of July 21, 2018.{{Cite magazine|url=https://www.billboard.com/charts/independent-albums|title=Independent Albums|magazine=Billboard|access-date=2018-07-21}} ==Personal life== By age 13, Grand had come to the realization that he was [[gay]]{{cite interview | title=All-American Boy' Becomes A Gay Themed Country Music Hit on YouTube | date=July 11, 2013 | access-date=July 11, 2013 | interviewer=Roz and Mocha | work=Roz and Mocha Show | publisher=Kiss 92.5 | url=http://www.kiss925.com/2013/07/11/roz-mocha-exclusive-interview-tomorrow-on-kiss-92-5-all-american-boy-becomes-a-gay-themed-country-music-hit-on-youtube/ | url-status=dead | archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130820185013/http://www.kiss925.com/2013/07/11/roz-mocha-exclusive-interview-tomorrow-on-kiss-92-5-all-american-boy-becomes-a-gay-themed-country-music-hit-on-youtube/ | archive-date=August 20, 2013 | df=mdy-all }} and struggled to gain acceptance of his sexuality within his [[Roman Catholicism|Catholic]] family and faith. He [[coming out|came out]] to friends starting in eighth grade.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} On ''Good Morning America'' Steve shared how difficult it was for him to come out to his parents as a high school student—saying with obvious emotion "I felt like I was a shame to my parents and that there was no way I could ever make them proud"․ When his parents learned of his [[homosexuality]], they encouraged him to seek counseling that would last five years. While some have called his therapy [[conversion therapy]], he has not. In an interview with Michael Musto of Out.com, Grand said: "I want to make it clear that it's been misrepresented that I went through what most people know as conversion therapy. I saw a Christian therapist who, among many other beliefs, believed I'd be happier in a straight life. He didn't shame me for being gay. Most of the focus, we weren't even talking about my sexuality. But certainly his belief that I'd be living a happier life as a heterosexual was indeed harmful. In no way, shape, or form ... do I condone ex-gay therapy. I think it's a horrible practice. There's no scientific basis for it. A person's sexuality is a part of who they are. And I certainly suffered for not having my sexuality affirmed."{{cite news|last=Musto|first=Michael|title=Musto! The Musical! Country Singer Steve Grand: On Gayness, the Church, and Lusting For Straights|url=http://www.out.com/entertainment/michael-musto/2013/10/28/steve-grand-gayness-church-lusting-straight-country-singer|publisher=Out.com|date=October 28, 2013}} He came out at age 19, and has attended the [[Chicago Gay Pride]] parade. In June 2015, Steve was interviewed by Johnny McGovern and described his coming out process as well as his musical development through his first album.{{Citation|last=[[Hey Qween!]]|title=Steve Grand on Hey Qween with Jonny McGovern|date=2015-06-08|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YSdaat0AJ-E|access-date=2016-10-31}} In December 2015, Steve went public with his move toward sobriety.{{Cite news|url=http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/steve-grand-its-great-not-performing-drunk-all-the-time/#gs.RriyROU|title=Steve Grand: 'It's great not performing drunk all the time'|date=2016-03-04|newspaper=Gay Star News|language=en-GB|access-date=2016-10-31}} ==Activism== Grand has become an active figure in the LGBT equality movement.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} In addition to being a singer-songwriter and performer, Grand has performed at Pride events – and has partnered with The [[Human Rights Campaign]]{{clarify|date=February 2015}} The Anti-Violence Project, [[Bailey House (charity)|Bailey House]], the [[GLSEN Respect Awards]], [[Out & Equal|Out & Equal Workplace Advocates]] and the March on Springfield for Marriage Equality.{{citation needed|date=February 2015}} In 2014, he was one of the performers at the opening ceremonies of [[WorldPride]] in [[Toronto]], [[Ontario]], Canada.[https://www.thestar.com/news/pridetoronto/2014/06/19/rise_up_the_theme_as_worldpride_2014_arrives.html "Rise Up" the theme as WorldPride 2014 arrives]. ''[[Toronto Star]]'', June 19, 2014. In June 2015, Steve Grand visited Riga, Latvia, to teach a master's class and to take part in the Europride festival that was held in the country's capital city.{{cite web| url = http://www.gaystarnews.com/article/steve-grand-and-stuart-milk-attend-europride-riga-latvia-%E2%80%93-full-report-pictures220615/| title = Steve Grand and Stuart Milk attend EuroPride in Riga, Latvia – full report with pictures}} ==In popular culture== Steve Grand has become a media-sought figure as a gay young artist.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} In 2013, he appeared on ''Out'' magazine's "Out100" list of prominent LGBT people.{{citation needed|date=June 2015}} He also appeared in 2013 on ''[[Instinct (magazine)|Instinct]]'' gay American magazine's cover as one of its "Leading Men". In 2016, Grand was included in ''Out'' Magazine's 100 Most Eligible Bachelors.{{Cite news|url=https://www.out.com/100-most-eligible-gay-bachelors-2016/#steve-grand|title=100 Most Eligible Bachelors 2016|access-date=2018-07-18|language=en}} In May 2017 Steve was named the #3 most eligible Gay Bachelor by ''Attitude'' Magazine.{{Cite news|url=http://attitude.co.uk/in-pictures-attitudes-bachelors-of-the-year/|title=Out Magazine|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20170505083541/http://attitude.co.uk/in-pictures-attitudes-bachelors-of-the-year/|archive-date=2017-05-05|url-status=dead}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.homorazzi.com/article/top-gay-bachelors-attitude-magazine-top-20-list-2017-charlie-carver/|title=Attitude Magazine Names Top 20 Eligible Gay Bachelors Of 2017|date=2017-04-28|work=Homorazzi Media|access-date=2018-07-18|language=en-US}} ==Discography== {{Main|Steve Grand discography}} *[[All American Boy (Steve Grand album)|''All American Boy'']] (2015) *''Not the End of Me'' (2018) ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} ==External links== * {{Official website}} * [https://shopgrandaxis.com/ Steve Grand -
